intro: Allium margaritaceum subsp. guttatum, commonly known as the pearl onion garlic, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bulbous structure, which consists of layers of fleshy, white to pale yellow scales. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from the base of the plant. Native to southern Europe, this species is often cultivated for its mild, sweet flavor and ornamental value.
